title: 112th Problem 2016
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Borro takes a job starting with an hourly wage of $14 and is promised a raise of $5 per hour per two months for 5 years."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"After 5 years, what would be Borro's hourly wage?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that 5 years = 30 half years.   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the wages follow an "},{"type":"text","text":"arithmetic progression","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19, 24, 29, \cdots"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
The wage at the end of 5 years is the 30th term of this arithmetic progression = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19 + (30-1)×5 = 19 + 145 = \color{#3D99F6}{\boxed{164}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: A classical mechanics problem by Aman Joshi
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A car moving along a straight road at a speed of u m/s applies brakes at t = 0 second. The
ratio of distances travelled by the car during 3rd and 8th secondis 15 : 13. The car covers a
distance of 0.25 m in the last second of its travel. Therefore, the acceleration a(in m/s2)
and the speed u(in m/s) of the car are respectively"}]}]}
